federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: **Mandatory reporters** (designated professionals) must report suspected child abuse or neglect. Federal law sets the funding and policy floor (CAPTA) and mandates reporter frameworks on federal lands/facilities (VICAA).
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html:
- **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî federal floor for state reporting systems  
- **Victims of Child Abuse Act (34 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 20301‚Äì20307)** ‚Äî includes federal-facility reporter duties (recodified from former 42 U.S.C. ¬ß13031)
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: A designated professional (e.g., health, education, law-enforcement, social work) has reasonable cause to suspect child abuse or neglect and files a report.

reporting_obligation.when: Immediately or as soon as practicable upon reasonable suspicion (state-defined timing; federal floor via CAPTA funding conditions).
reporting_obligation.to_whom: Designated state CPS/child welfare agency or local law enforcement.
reporting_obligation.method: Hotline, telephone, or other statutorily specified means with required content fields.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: Any person (not just mandated reporters) may submit a **voluntary report** to child-protection authorities. CAPTA requires states to maintain mechanisms for intake, confidentiality, and immunity policies tied to federal funding.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html: - **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî requires states to operate intake/report systems that accept voluntary reports and protect good-faith reporters
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: A private citizen or non-mandated individual reports suspected abuse/neglect.

reporting_obligation.when: As soon as practicable, upon knowledge or suspicion.
reporting_obligation.to_whom: State CPS/child welfare intake or law enforcement.
reporting_obligation.method: Hotline or other designated channels; confidentiality provisions apply.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: A **law-enforcement agency** encounters suspected maltreatment (e.g., during a domestic call or arrest) and **refers** to CPS. Federal child-abuse infrastructure promotes coordinated investigations via Children‚Äôs Advocacy Centers.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html:
- **Victims of Child Abuse Act (34 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 20301‚Äì20307)** ‚Äî support for multidisciplinary teams and CAC protocols; coordination with CPS  
- **ASFA/SSA IV-E** ‚Äî court findings and reasonable-efforts determinations later constrain downstream actions
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: Police encounter facts suggesting abuse/neglect and transmit a referral to CPS for screening/investigation.

reporting_obligation.when: Upon discovery or incident closure, per inter-agency protocols.
reporting_obligation.method: Direct referral, secure electronic exchange, or documented notice per MOU/policy.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: A **judge orders** CPS to investigate or assess during civil/criminal proceedings. Federal funding statutes (ASFA/IV-E) tether court findings to child-welfare actions, embedding judicial oversight into intake-to-case flow.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html:
- **ASFA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 671‚Äì675)** ‚Äî court ‚Äòreasonable efforts‚Äô findings; permanency timelines  
- **SSA Title IV-E (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 670‚Äì679c)** ‚Äî funding structure linking court oversight to agency actions
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: A court, in an existing proceeding, issues an order directing CPS to investigate or provide assessment/services.

reporting_obligation.when: As specified by court order or state rule.
reporting_obligation.to_whom: Assigned CPS unit and the court.
reporting_obligation.method: Filed report/assessment to the court and agency case system.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: A **parent/guardian/child requests help** without a substantiated allegation. FFPSA created a federal pathway for **prevention services** to avert removal and stabilize families before a case escalates.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html: - **Family First Prevention Services Act (2018)** ‚Äî prevention services, kinship support; shifts upstream from removal to support
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: A family voluntarily seeks assistance (e.g., mental health, parenting, housing navigation) to prevent crisis.

reporting_obligation.to_whom: CPS prevention/IV-E prevention services unit or contracted provider.
reporting_obligation.method: Documented prevention plan; informed consent; service referrals.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: Reports via **state hotlines** (anonymous or confidential). CAPTA conditions funding on operating intake systems with confidentiality and good-faith protections.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html: - **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî intake, confidentiality, immunity, and data requirements tied to federal funding
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: An anonymous/confidential reporter provides allegations to the hotline.

reporting_obligation.when: Immediate intake; screening timelines set by state policy within CAPTA conditions.
reporting_obligation.to_whom: State CPS intake; law enforcement when indicated.
reporting_obligation.method: Hotline call/electronic intake; confidentiality preserved; immunity for good-faith reporters.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: **Healthcare encounters** that reveal suspected abuse or neglect trigger reporting obligations. Federal law governs mandatory reporting in federal facilities and coordination with state systems.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html:
- **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî state reporter systems and protections  
- **Victims of Child Abuse Act (34 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 20301‚Äì20307)** ‚Äî mandates in federal settings, CAC coordination
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: A medical professional, during diagnosis or treatment, observes indicators consistent with abuse/neglect.

reporting_obligation.to_whom: State CPS or law enforcement per state statute; federal-facility routes when applicable.
reporting_obligation.method: Hotline or mandated facility protocol; documentation per statute/regulation.

source_reference: CAPTA and VICAA medical reporter frameworks

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: **Educators/school staff** observing indicators of abuse/neglect report to CPS under state mandatory-reporter lists built on the federal CAPTA floor.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html: - **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî requires robust reporter regimes that include education sector professionals
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: Teacher/school official identifies neglect/abuse indicators and files a mandatory report.

reporting_obligation.when: Immediately or per state-set time rule.
reporting_obligation.method: District protocols ‚Üí hotline or law-enforcement notice; content as specified in statute.

source_reference: CAPTA teacher/education inclusion under state reporter systems

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: Findings by **federal/state oversight** (CFSR reviews, OIG audits, child-fatality commissions) can initiate investigations or corrective actions that open CPS involvement.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html:
- **Protect Our Kids Act (PL 112-275)** ‚Äî national commission on child abuse/neglect fatalities  
- **Child & Family Services Reviews (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî federal monitoring of state systems  
- **Inspector General Act (5 U.S.C. App.)** ‚Äî OIG oversight of HHS/ACF and grantees
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: An audit/review identifies risk, noncompliance, or fatalities patterns requiring CPS/agency action.

reporting_obligation.when: Per review timelines and corrective-action schedules.
reporting_obligation.to_whom: Responsible CPS leadership; sometimes court-ordered compliance monitors.
reporting_obligation.method: Formal findings ‚Üí corrective action plans; referrals to investigative units as needed.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: An intake **screen** is elevated to a formal **investigation/assessment** under state criteria. CAPTA and CFSR establish the federal expectations for screening, timelines, and investigative quality.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html:
- **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî screening/investigation conditions for funding  
- **CFSR (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî federal performance/quality review framework
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: CPS intake criteria are met; the screened report is escalated to investigation or differential response.

reporting_obligation.when: Within state-defined screening timelines consistent with federal guidance.
reporting_obligation.method: Case creation; notice to collateral agencies as required; documentation in SACWIS/CCWIS.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: Cases arising on **federal lands/facilities** or involving **Indian children** invoke federal/tribal jurisdictional rules (VICAA for federal facilities; **ICWA** for Indian children and tribal preference/jurisdiction).
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html:
- **VICAA (34 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 20301‚Äì20307)** ‚Äî federal-facility reporting mandates  
- **ICWA (25 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 1901‚Äì1963)** ‚Äî tribal jurisdiction, placement preferences, notice to tribes
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: Abuse/neglect allegations on federal property or involving an Indian child as defined by ICWA.

reporting_obligation.when: Immediately upon suspicion; tribal/federal notice rules apply.
reporting_obligation.to_whom: CPS intake; tribal authority and/or federal agency per ICWA/VICAA.
reporting_obligation.method: Statutory notice to tribe; federal-facility protocols; parallel CPS intake record.

federal_inp_nodes.summary_html: Immediate state action to **protect a child in imminent danger**. Federal law (ASFA/IV-E) ties funding to court findings on **reasonable efforts**, and constitutional limits (due process, 4th/14th Amendments) constrain warrantless removals.
federal_inp_nodes.authority_html:
- **ASFA / SSA Title IV-E** ‚Äî reasonable-efforts findings; permanency timelines  
- **CFSR (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî federal oversight of removal decision quality  
- **Constitutional constraints** ‚Äî enforced via ¬ß1983 actions; due process & search/seizure jurisprudence (not listed in file but governs practice)
federal_inp_nodes.triggering_event: Child faces imminent threat of serious harm; agency acts prior to court order.

reporting_obligation.when: Immediate removal followed by prompt judicial review (state-specific timeline; federally overseen).
reporting_obligation.to_whom: Juvenile/dependency court; CPS leadership; law enforcement if criminal conduct present.
reporting_obligation.method: Protective custody; emergency petition; notice to parties; court hearing within statutory window.
